question: 15th Meeting of India-US Joint Working Group on Counter Terrorism held in __________.
explanation: The 15th meeting of the India-US Counterterrorism Joint Working Group was held in New Delhi. The India delegation was led by Ministry of External Affairs Joint Secretary Mahaveer Singhvi. US delegation was led by U.S. State Department's Principal Deputy Coordinator for Counterterrorism, Alina L. Romanowski. Threats posed by terrorist groups throughout the world and in their respective regions including cross border terrorism in the South Asian region were reviewed by the working group. Both countries ensured to strengthen information exchange on world's most dangerous terrorist groups and individuals. They discussed efforts to curb the funding and operations of regional and global terrorist organizations. Also international and bilateral cooperation on justice, law enforcement and capacity building efforts to counter terrorism and UN Security. The next meeting of the Joint Working Group will be hosted by the United States in 2019.
